sect2.title: Export File
sect2.para: GIMP uses the Save command only for saving images in its native XCF format. When you need your image in a different file format, you can use the Export command.

listitem.para:
You can access this command in the main menu through
File Export Asâ€¦ ,
or from the keyboard by using the shortcut CtrlShiftE .

sect3.title: The Export Image Dialog
sect3.para: In the file browser, you can edit filename and extension directly in the Name field (default is Untitled.png) or by selecting an existing file to override in name list. Navigate the folders if you prefer a different image destination. You can also create a new folder if necessary.

formalpara.title: Select File Type
formalpara.para: If you expand this option, you can select the file format and related file extension for your file in the list.

sect3.para: File formats dialogs are described in .

sect3.title: Exporting
sect3.para: When file name and destination are set, click on Export. This opens the export dialog for the specified file format.

note.para: If the name you entered already existed, you will be asked if you want to overwrite that file or not. If a layer mask or channel is selected instead of a layer, and the export format does not support this, you will be asked for confirmation.

sect3.para:
If you have loaded a non-XCF file, the
File Overwrite
command (followed by the file name) allows you to overwrite the original file, keeping its file format.

If you modify an image that you already have exported before, the
File Export to
command (followed by the file name) allows you to export the file again in the same file format.
